comment:
Nose: Green apple, peat smoke
Palete: light, vanilla, honey
Finish: butterscotch peat

Only 43% alcohol but it comes with a significant burn, just because it’s too young. If you put an ice cube in the glass and wait a few minutes, you can tame the alcohol and end up with a nice, pretty whiskey. But still.

I really ought to try making a highball out of it. It seems like that’s what it’s really for.

Nose- herbal (rosemary,rose water, wild flowers) pear, honey, ginger, musty oak

Palate- honey, herbal notes of rosemary and wild flowers, white chocolate, orange peel, malt, light oak

Finish- Medium, oily finish with bright ginger and chocolate 

Very good. Does not disappoint, great for the price. Finish could be longer and could have a bit more complexity to it, but the more I sip the more flavors open up. By no means is it bold and in your face, more light and elegant, in all the best ways.

Nose: floral, sugary, hint of citrus
Palate: fruity (plum or pear), floral, lightly buttery
Finish: short, smooth

Floral Nose
Viscous mouthfeel 
Gentle, fruity palette with a surprising but pleasant  burn closer to the tip of your tongue.

Honey, light vanilla, floral on the nose.  Palate is smooth, floral, creamy, slight pepper on the end with no alcohol burn to speak of.  Medium finish reinforcing the initial palate, but slightly dry. Decent choice to share with a new whiskey drinker, or as a first pour of an intro to Japanese Whiskey tasting.
FIRE • WHITE CHOCOLATE • HONEY • SUMMER • “MOON BABY”

As hyped, just a wonderful blend of Japanese whiskey ticking off all the right boxes with finesse and elegance. Would love to score much higher but that would likely conflict with the aged statement examples going for big bucks. But if you took this NAS version and added some extra depth and complexity, would absolutely rate it as perfection. As it stands, it's an excellent Japanese NAS bottle at an accessible price so ig thumbs up.
Exactly like the name, this is whisky harmony. Delicate and brazen at the same time. Outstanding.
Smooth, no smoke, caramel, almost bourbon like. Perfect neat
Definitely get a honey and lychee nose. I get honey and a bit of citrus on the taste. Medium finish with some vanilla oak.

★★★½
Déception!
Après un coup de circuit avec les Quinta Ruban, me voici retiré sur trois prises avec ce whisky japonais trop cher pour ce qu'il a à offrir. J'ai l'impression de voguer sur une rivière limpide où une eau cristalline me comble de bonheur. Malheureusement, je ne me suis pas ici pour m'abreuver d'amour et d'eau fraîche!
A little bit of smoke, well balanced

Nose: Citrus
Palate: cinnamon,  
Finish, medium, tobacco

Nose
Cinnamon
Oak

Palate
Sandlewood
Short
Peat
Spice
Oak
Medicinal

Great nose 
Smooth and sweet - cinnamon
Short finish but spiciness lingers  
Smooth drinker.
Floral nose, sweet balanced taste, and short finish
Pears, green apple, sweetness and a hint of peat. Well balance and so delicious.
Light and floral on nose, gentle and smooth with low alcohol bite, sweet on finish. Enjoy neat

I just realized i have never rated this whisky in barreled, i simply love this monster, it is one of my favorites and i am writing this review out of my memory. 

43%abv, burnished gold.

On the nose is so complex. It chanhes everytime you enter into the glencairn. Orange jam, floral notes, kiwi, lemon, chocolate, creme brulee. On the palate is full of oak, oranges, dark chocolate and it leaves you a full mouth sensation that starts in your tongue and starts building up till it reaches the top of your mouth.

I have drink it enough to low its original score (it was 100) to 97, but it is one of my all time favorites. Slainte!

Nose: Honey, floral notes, a hint of cinnamon

Palate: Quite smooth initially. Notes of peaches, cereals, cinnamon. Some sherry cask coming through. 

Finish: Short to medium. Mild to moderate burn and tannins. Dried fruits. Very slight hint of peat smoke.

Overall a very good whisky, but there are definitely much better values out there in the Japanese whisky category and any whisky category for that matter given this price point.
Gedronken op rooftopbar in Parijs met uitzicht op Eiffeltoren. Leuk om eens geen Ierse/Schotse whisky te drinken
Nice flavor profile with a reasonable finish.
Alcohol on the nose. After tasting very smooth. Very smoky
Floral/perfume smell. Tastes like dark fruit and spice.
Floral bright notes smoky at the end and sharp on the finish
Suntory company in Japan has good reputation for their own way of whiskey. And you never go wrong with Hibiki series.
Love this light but incredibly smooth blend. It has a creamy/oily mouth and palate. Reminiscent of scotch but floral, honey hints without being sweet at all.
Very floral on the nose especially after going on ice.
Tastes like blue label. Light, smooth and easy to drink. Would buy again

This can be a very divisive whiskey I have tried several bottles of it and every group I drink with has different things to say. For me I really like it. It is smooth and pleasant to drink neat or with a touch of water or a bit of ice. The flavor lingers in my mouth and it changes wonderfully and the burn is nice. I do think it is about $10 overpriced but it is a very good whiskey for special occasions but too pricey for an everyday drinker.
Noses floral, light oak spice. Palate is light, sweet and has a background of sherry mixed in with spiciness, definitely love that it’s balanced out the sweet and bitter.
Sherry and oak with creamy mouthfeel

향 : 따뜻한 비내린 숲속, 가라앉음, 
맛 : 꿀, 부드러움, 차분함, 얌전함, 흙내음, 향긋함, 실키함
피니쉬 : 은은함, 살짝 흙, 부드러움

Dark yellow on the pour. Nose is light with floral notes. Some sherry sweetness along with an almost jasmin like flavor on the palate. Slight heat going down. Medium mouthfeel and a short-medium finish.
Overall the flavor is stronger than two other Japanese whiskies I've tried (Nikka Malt and Toki) but still more mellow than most Scotch.
One of my favorites under $100. Incredibly balanced and nice finish. Prefer it neat. I wish it was easier to find.
Smoky, almost Scotchlike but very enjoyable with a quick finishing after taste
Nice Japanese whisky, slightly creamy and floral taste
One of my favorites, sweet, light, and scotch like.
Nice creamy mouthfeel. I get floral and honey, with some oak and smoke.

A  hint caramel and floral up front,  nice and subtle in the middle, finishes fairly warm a little more than I prefer.  I put some on the rocks and it paired nicely for the second drink!  I would give it  3.5 out of five.
Rose nose and floral taste.  Spicy finish.
Chocolate, woody, a hint of sweet
A bit too floral for my taste
Citrus nose, some herbal and oak. Sherry and light berry, citrus. Lingering oak, slightly tannic finish.

Check out my video review here! 

https://youtu.be/AwX85HhGCeA




.
Sublime, this is really good sipping option, very smooth. I usually prefer heavily peated Scotch but this one is not very peated but is wonderful.
Nose: floral. Taste: Oak/pine, peppercorn, caramel/vanilla finish
I detected strong oak notes on both the nose and palate.  Sweet, dry and quite enjoyable.  Japanese whiskey is very similar to scotch, this is a prime example of this.
Vanilla citrus fruity notes on palate. Did not appreciate any peaty or smoky flavors. Light whiskey.. can drink near or with small amount of ice or water on a summer day.

The smell of alcohol pours over the top of the glass on each approach. The harsh sense dissipates upon the taste of the refined liquid. The forward wood notes fill the pallet and are complemented by the balanced cherry and vanilla flavors. 

This is easily one of the easiest drinking whiskeys in the collection.
Subtle with floral, vanilla and honey notes. A little smoke too. Feels light yet rich at the same time. Very nice whiskey.
Nice floral aroma but this version has more bite than the 12 y.o. version it replaced.
Light and floral, almost a green apple on the nose. Super delicate and refreshing. Absolutely amazing

Nose: Sour Green Apple, Pear and  Persimmon,  Honey Dew Mellon and Red Plum. 

Opens with light malt and white wine becoming more substantial with some corn sugars and wood notes, the malt is carefully contained in percentage to prevent it from stepping on the finer notes and more subtle floral fragrances. 

Finishes slightly dry and pungent, incredibly pure and completely burn free. 

The latest standard "Harmony" offering from Suntori is a well refined exhibit in Japanese craftsmanship.  The array of subtle or even delicate notes persists with astonishing balance as the name "Harmony" truly stands up with dignified assurance.  Hibiki has become known as a brand that demands respect, and for good reason, this whiskey is a distilling essay on how to craft a balance of well blended notes into a carefully planned  impression.  An array of brilliant and strikingly well produced essences of whiskey.  That's Hibiki Harmony. Cheers!

Big vanilla and green apple nose with jasmine flower—smells amazing; fairly big burn for a blend by a major Japanese distiller, oak and apple with some honey; finishes with honey and persimmon; overall not as complex and fruity as the original hibiki and I will never forgive it for that, fair or not

Finally a decent Japanese...not sure why I bought the cheaper stuff before. Far superior to Toki. Herbal and Floral on the nose. Palate is great. Oak, honey, vanilla. I don't think I need to spend more money and this one is staying in the bar
